item.title: General Catalyst commits $5B to India over five years
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The pledge marks a sharp jump from General Catalyst's earlier $500 million–$1 billion India earmark.

item.title: Ali Partovi’s Neo looks to upend the accelerator model with low-dilution terms
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Neo's new Residency program invests $750,000 in an uncapped SAFE for startups and provides a $40,000 no-strings-attached grant for college students.

item.title: Google’s new Gemini Pro model has record benchmark scores — again
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Gemini 3.1 Pro promises a Google LLM capable of handling more complex forms of work.

item.title: Nvidia deepens early-stage push into India’s AI startup ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Nvidia is working with investors, nonprofits, and venture firms to build earlier ties with India's fast-growing AI founder ecosystem.

item.title: FBI says ATM ‘jackpotting’ attacks are on the rise, and netting hackers millions in stolen cash
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The FBI says hacks that trick ATMs into spitting out cash on demand are rising, with hundreds of attacks in the past year alone netting hackers millions in stolen bills.

item.title: At a critical moment, Snap loses a top Specs exec
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: As Snap readies the public release of its long-awaited VR glasses, one of the key executives on the project has left the company.

item.title: Second and last chance for innovators to win scaling perks: Belden extends nomination window
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Last day to nominate for the 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award has been extended through February 27. Don't miss your chance to win scaling perks.

item.title: Cellebrite cut off Serbia citing abuse of its phone unlocking tools. Why not others?
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Cellebrite, which makes phone unlocking and hacking tools, stopped sales to countries that allegedly abused its tools. But after new allegations in Jordan and Kenya, the company has changed its approach.

item.title: Google says its AI systems helped deter Play Store malware in 2025
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google said it prevented 1.75 million bad apps from going live on Google Play during 2025, a figure that's down from previous years.

item.title: An AI data center boom is fueling Redwood’s energy storage business
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Redwood Materials says its new energy storage business is the fastest growing unit within the company.

item.title: Why these startup CEOs don’t think AI will replace human roles
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The CEOs of Read AI and Lucidya told TechCrunch at Web Summit Qatar that they see AI tools replacing tasks, rather than workers.

item.title: YouTube’s latest experiment brings its conversational AI tool to TVs
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: YouTube is testing conversational AI on smart TVs, allowing viewers to ask the assistant questions related to the video they're watching on the big screen.

item.title: Toyota contracts seven Agility humanoid robots for Canadian factory
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: The robots will be unloading totes full of auto parts from an automated warehouse tugger.

item.title: The boys’ club no one was supposed to write about
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Reporter Zoë Bernard spent months talking to 51 people (31 of them gay men) to map out a subculture that's been an open secret in Silicon Valley for years: gay men, at the upper echelons of tech, quietly raising up their own networks the way powerful people have always done.

item.title: SpaceX’s Starbase city is getting its own court
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Elon Musk's company town already has a volunteer fire department, and is forming a Starbase Police Department. Now it wants its own court, too.

item.title: As browser wars heat up, Chrome adds new productivity features
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Split View, PDF annotations, and 'Save to Chrome' features come to the Chrome browser.

item.title: Reddit is testing a new AI search feature for shopping
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: A small group of users in the U.S. will start to see search results that include interactive product carousels with pricing, images, and direct where-to-buy links.

item.title: All the important news from the ongoing India AI Impact Summit
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: India is hosting a four-day AI Summit this week that will be attended by executives from major AI labs and Big Tech, including OpenAI, Anthropic, Nvidia, Microsoft, Google, and Cloudflare, as well as heads of state.

item.title: Meta is shutting down Messenger’s standalone website
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The move comes a few months after Meta shut down Messenger’s standalone desktop apps for Windows and Mac.

item.title: New York hits the brakes on robotaxi expansion plan
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The governor of New York pulled a robotaxi expansion proposal that was viewed as a win for Waymo.
